channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, still one active case
item.description: There have been no new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand for the eighth straight day, with just one active case still remaining in New Zealand.

item.title: Police Eagle helicopters called out more than 16 times a day
item.description: Police are using the Eagle helicopters for an average of more than 16 incidents a day, at a cost to taxpayers of more than $2000 an hour.

item.title: Search for missing woman continues
item.description: The search for a missing woman in the Hunua Ranges will continue today, weather permitting.

item.title: Warning as more people head off for outdoor adventures
item.description: Outdoor explorers are being warned against venturing out beyond their limits this long weekend.

item.title: Man reported missing in central Dunedin
item.description: Police are trying to find a man who was reported missing in central Dunedin.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 29 May
item.description: The government announces a $175 million arts and creative sector recovery package, Auckland and Wellington take financial hits due to Covid-19 and there were no new cases today.

item.title: Covid-19: 'It's a risk management exercise at this point'
item.description: There is now only one active case of Covid-19 in the country, but an expert on data modelling is warning there will be fresh challenges ahead.

item.title: Covid-19: Auction tests demand for Queenstown property
item.description: Bidders in Queenstown have started testing the water in one of the country's most expensive property markets.

item.title: Artists and musicians mostly 'thrilled' by new govt funding for arts
item.description: Many artists and musicians are welcoming a $175 million government package aimed at protecting 90,000 jobs.

item.title: Working from home puts a dent in Wellington CBD economy
item.description: While the government is pouring money into Covid-19 recovery for businesses, government departments being criticised for keeping staff at home.

item.title: Race relations commissioner speaks out over student's blackface selfie
item.description: New Zealand's Race Relations Commissioner Meng Foon wants an Auckland high school to apologise and educate a student who wore black face.

item.title: Corrections officer shot at in Whanganui Prison carpark
item.description: A Corrections officer was followed and shot at in the Whanganui Prison carpark.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases in New Zealand for one full week
item.description: There are no new cases of Covid-19 in the country today and just one active case left, as New Zealand marks a week since the last confirmed case.

item.title: Multi-million dollar boost will aid Transmission Gully restart
item.description: Wellington's billion dollar project Transmission Gully is getting a $14 million boost to kick the project back into action as negotiations continue.

item.title: 'Turd taxis' back on Wellington streets after brief reprieve
item.description: Wellington's 'turd taxis' are back in action less than a week after they were stood down.

item.title: Huge funding boost for predator control on West Coast mountain
item.description: The Government plans to spend $15.7 million to eradicate predators around Lake Brunner/ Kotuku Whakaoho in the South Island.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 live updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: Changes to alert level two that allow people to gather in groups of up to 100 people came into force at midday today. See how the rest of the day's developments unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Covid-19: Auckland City services to be cut after revenue drop
item.description: Deep cuts to Auckland City services are on the way, because of the huge financial hit of the Covid-19 crisis.
